content: Instead of telling other women about being “financially self supporting” — you should tell them to be more careful about the choices they make in choosing partners. The red flags were there and you ignored them and paid the price. Maybe you believed that you could “change him”. We keep telling women that its their right to any choices they make without any responsibility and western ideals put them first when they fall into difficulty. Now i can go and write a blog post about how i was screwed in divorce and marriage by a narcissistic unfaithful false accusing woman and then doubly screwed over by divorce/family law culture that screws men — but it wont take long for people to point out that i’d be wrong to make any generalizations and that is what this article is about. You set yourself up as the pillar of financial responsibility in your opening, and then you do the most financially irresponsible thing — it does not add up.
